body_html:
Running tensorflow/benchmarks@0f0492d (a few commits after this introduces an operation from master that isn't in 1.4).

python tf_cnn_benchmarks.py --num_gpus=4 --batch_size=64 --model=inception3 --variable_update=parameter_server --local_parameter_device=cpu

Machine is 4x Titan V with driver 387.34. Both versions are Tensorflow 1.4.1.

GPUs CUDA 9.0.176 + cuDNN 7.0.5 CUDA 9.1.85 + cuDNN 7.0.5
1 191.56 images/sec 191.59 images/sec
4 727.90 images/sec 738.54 images/sec

I only ran these once, so I'm not sure that the increased 4 GPU performance is significant. I can run it on imagenet data if you'd like to see that, as well.

body:
Running https://github.com/tensorflow/benchmarks/commit/0f0492dd5590549e1ce7d1d91bf5c88794f95f69 (a few commits after this introduces an operation from master that isn't in 1.4).

```
python tf_cnn_benchmarks.py --num_gpus=4 --batch_size=64 --model=inception3 --variable_update=parameter_server --local_parameter_device=cpu
```

Machine is 4x Titan V with driver 387.34. Both versions are Tensorflow 1.4.1.

| GPUs | CUDA 9.0.176 + cuDNN 7.0.5 | CUDA 9.1.85 + cuDNN 7.0.5 |
| :---: | :---: | :---: |
| 1 | 191.56 images/sec | 191.59 images/sec |
| 4 | 727.90 images/sec | 738.54 images/sec |

I only ran these once, so I'm not sure that the increased 4 GPU performance is significant. I can run it on imagenet data if you'd like to see that, as well.
